title: My Weekly Diet
text:
Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and whole wheat toast.
Snack: Greek yogurt with honey and almonds.
Lunch: Quinoa salad with boiled eggs, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese.
Snack: Apple slices with peanut butter.
Dinner: Grilled eggplant and zucchini with poached egg.





Breakfast: Omelette with onions, bell peppers, and cheese.
Snack: Cottage cheese with pineapple.
Lunch: Lentil soup with a hard-boiled egg and whole grain bread.
Snack: Carrot sticks with hummus.
Dinner: Baked sweet potato with a side of egg salad.





Breakfast: Egg and avocado toast on whole grain bread.
Snack: Banana and a handful of walnuts.
Lunch: Spinach and mushroom frittata.
Snack: Orange slices and a few dark chocolate squares.
Dinner: Stir-fried tofu with vegetables and a side of scrambled eggs.





Breakfast: Greek yogurt with mixed berries and granola.
Snack: Sliced pear with a small portion of blue cheese.
Lunch: Chickpea salad with olives, tomatoes, cucumber, and hard-boiled eggs.
Snack: Mixed nuts.
Dinner: Baked salmon with a side of roasted asparagus and poached egg.





Breakfast: Pancakes topped with strawberries and a dollop of yogurt.
Snack: Sliced apple with almond butter.
Lunch: Egg fried rice with vegetables.
Snack: Celery sticks with cream cheese.
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with rice, beans, and boiled egg.





Breakfast: French toast with a side of mixed berries.
Snack: Cottage cheese with sliced peaches.
Lunch: Mixed bean salad with boiled eggs and avocado.
Snack: A handful of dried fruit.
Dinner: Egg curry with brown rice.





Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with spinach, banana, protein powder, and topped with chia seeds.
Snack: Yogurt with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
Lunch: Veggie wrap with hummus and sliced boiled eggs.
Snack: Mixed seeds and nuts.
Dinner: Grilled portobello mushrooms with a side of quinoa and a poached egg.

5 Overview1
See Figure 1 in Section 6 for a demonstration of a simple plot.
See Equation 1 to better understand standard deviation.

title: Quarto Document
text:
6 Plot


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot([1,23,2,4])
plt.show()





Figure 1: Simple Plot

title: Quarto Document
text:
8 Placing Colorbars
Colorbars indicate the quantitative extent of image data. Placing in a figure is non-trivial because room needs to be made for them. The simplest case is just attaching a colorbar to each axes:1.


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 2)
fig.set_size_inches(20, 8)
cmaps = ['RdBu_r', 'viridis']
for col in range(2):
    for row in range(2):
        ax = axs[row, col]
        pcm = ax.pcolormesh(
          np.random.random((20, 20)) * (col + 1),
          cmap=cmaps[col]
        )
        fig.colorbar(pcm, ax=ax)
plt.show()

title: Quarto Document
text:
Footnotes


See the Matplotlib Gallery to explore colorbars further↩︎

About this blog
Hello! I am Yash Gupta aka boi-doingthings. I am interested in using Data Science to solve business problems.
